comments.body:
Re:  second sentence of [your suggestion](https://github.com/kevindelgado/kubernetes/commit/0e0248817b9f396b041295bc78486908e426e1d0#r48352264) 

In the specific case of the aggregator, I assume we want to set it in `createAggregatorConfig` rather than where we set `k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/server#Config.OpenAPIConfig` in [buildGenericConfig](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/cmd/kube-apiserver/app/server.go#L474) because that config is used by all the apiservers.

I was envisioning where kube-aggregator sets `k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/server#Config.OpenAPIConfig`:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/2f8a2258f45b409481cd66be7d34a5b482db3899/staging/src/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/cmd/server/start.go#L143-L144

oh interesting, done.

Just for my own curiosity, does kube-apiserver call `RunAggregator()` anywhere? I don't see it called and it's unclear how kube-apiserver makes use of config setting done in `RunAggregator()`

diffHunk:

	// has its own customized OpenAPI handler.
	genericConfig.SkipOpenAPIInstallation = true

	if utilfeature.DefaultFeatureGate.Enabled(genericfeatures.StorageVersionAPI) &&

comments.body: I wasn't sure about the version number. `15` comes from other API examples in this file

	{Group: "coordination.k8s.io", Version: "v1beta1"}:           {group: 16500, version: 9},
	{Group: "node.k8s.io", Version: "v1"}:                        {group: 16300, version: 15},
	{Group: "node.k8s.io", Version: "v1alpha1"}:                  {group: 16300, version: 1},
	{Group: "node.k8s.io", Version: "v1beta1"}:                   {group: 16300, version: 9},

comments.body: priority of this version relative to other versions in the same group... higher priority controls discovery order. we arbitrarily left a few slots available between betas and stable versions and this matches what we did elsewhere
So version means priority?  Got it.

	{Group: "batch", Version: "v2alpha1"}:                        {group: 17400, version: 9},
	{Group: "certificates.k8s.io", Version: "v1"}:                {group: 17300, version: 15},
	{Group: "certificates.k8s.io", Version: "v1beta1"}:           {group: 17300, version: 9},
	{Group: "networking.k8s.io", Version: "v1"}:                  {group: 17200, version: 15},

comments.body: Should this be feature-gated? What happens if the API isn't registered?
good question, @sttts @deads2k does this make sense here?

this are the priorities used for the APIService objects created, *if* the api groups are enabled. DefaultAPIResourceConfigSource() determines which groups are enabled by default, and auditregistrationv1alpha1.SchemeGroupVersion is explicitly disabled there.
Should the version be 9? I don't know what it should be. I just wanted to make sure it is the right number.

Yeah, I see all sort of versions, like v1, v2alpha1, v1alpha1 set to 9, but from the comment, I guess it doesn't matter and the version applies to the items in the same API group. So, we should be fine.
